name: Holiday Inn Select Memphis - Downtown (Beale Street)

reviews.title: Loved This Hotel
reviews.text: Our first Trip to Memphis , The hotel was excellent , Brilliant location good service clean .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is good along with the fitness room ( you,ll need to use this to keep off weight gain from the ribs ! )
reviews.title: Great location!

likes.liked: — Location was great and staff were really friendly
likes.disliked: — pool had been drained and it was hot!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar is a bit more expensive than others but you would expect that any way
reviews.title: Great Location - but Service was very poor.

reviews.text: A good hotel for a reasonable price in a very good location. The hotel is a little dated, but a good place to stay overall. Some spaces in the parking garage are very tight.
reviews.title: momoandmatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has rude staff, dirty rooms and if your room faces the Peabody hotel, lots of noise all night.
reviews.title: Not Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't seem to have to wait long for a lift but I would recommend parking on level 3 and walking up to level 4 as suggested in other reviews.
reviews.title: Maid service dreadful

likes.liked: — price of food, room service and location

reviews.text: The hotel needs complete modernisation. The rooms are dark and feel unclean, quite disgusting.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Select on Union- good for under $100, below expectations at 170

likes.liked: — Great location across from Peabody Hotel

reviews.title: Standard Expectations
reviews.text: On the plus side the location is good for all the Beale Street attractions.
Would I stay in this hotel again?? NO WAY.
reviews.title: Great Locaton - Good Price

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights recently and couldn't have chosen a better location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They serve a very good breakfast buffet, or you can choose from the varied menu. We very much appreciated the free use of two internet computers which meant we could keep in touch with family at home. Other more expensive hotels could take a note of this!
reviews.title: Well located hotel
Excellent!
reviews.text: We were allocated a front bedroom overlooking the Peabody hotel, just a short walk from Beale Street and the trolley bus on Main Street. I can recommend a visit to the Civil Rights Museum which is very interesting, and where you can see the site of the assassination of Martin Luther King. A trip on the River Mississippi is also very good as is the tour of Sun Studios.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Memphis, the highlight of which was a day trip to Graceland. It was very busy, but all very well organised. We particularly loved watching the Elvis lookalikes performing on the karaoke stage, and the man from Waterford in Ireland was fantastic.
reviews.title: Friday night Blues

likes.liked: — proximity to Beale Street, staff, cleanliness
likes.disliked: — No hospitality room (not even coffee in the lobby), charged parking fee that was comparable to lots in surrounding area.

reviews.text: I would not hesitate to recommend the Holiday Inn Select if you are considering visiting Memphis in the future.
reviews.title: Location great but rooms need an upgrade

likes.liked: — Location to Beale Street and other attractions
likes.disliked: — Poor quality bedlinen and small bathroom

reviews.text: Our daughter, her two year old, and I visited this hotel on Union Street. We were greeted with an efficient, warm hospitable southern charm. The front desk, the restraurant staff, the cleaning people, and the bell hop, were all very welcoming. Our room was very clean and cool in the 102 degree temperature days. I chose the hotel because of location. We enjoyed the trolley, the National Civil Rights Museum, the Arcade Restraurant, Beale Street. The Hard Rock Cafe, Hueys, and the delicious hot breakfasts at the hotel. It was a short drive to Graceland too. Our daughter and I both will recommend the Holiday Inn on Union Ave. to our friends and family.
reviews.title: Never again . . .

likes.disliked: — dirty bathroom with large hairs all over the place

aka: Holiday Inn Select Memphis - Downtown (Beale Street) Hotel Memphis
description: Take a video tour of this hotel!The Holiday Inn Select Hotel-Memphis is conveniently located in the heart of downtown Memphis, directly across the street from the famous Peabody Hotel and within walking distance of Beale Street, The NBA FedEx Arena, Peabody Place (Shops, Restaurants, and Starbucks Coffee) Mud Island, the Cook Convention Center, the Pyramid, Orpheum Theater, Autozone Ball Park 'Home of the Memphis Redbirds,' the Rock-n-Soul Museum, the Gibson Guitar Plant and many popular downtown restaurants and shops. Adjacent to the Rendezvous Restaurant. Complimentary wireless high-speed Internet access in all guest rooms and meeting space.
